bill.title: Counties; Compassion Centers
bill.description: Provides that each county has the power to establish compassion centers for the dispensing of medical marijuana. Requires that compassion centers shall only provide service to qualifying patients and primary caregivers registered with the department of public safety. Makes compassion centers subject to the general excise tax by making inapplicable the exemption for amounts received from sales of prescription drugs or prosthetic devices. Imposes a general excise tax on marijuana sales. Imposes registration fee on compassion centers, to be shared with counties. Effective August 7, 2112. (SB2113 HD1)

history.action: (S) Introduced.
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to TIA/PSM, WAM.

(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
(S) The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 02-18-10 9:45AM in conference room 211.
(S) The committee(s) on WAM deferred the measure until 02-22-10 10:00AM in conference room 211.

(S) 48 Hrs. Notice 03-02-10.

Lee, Takumi.

The votes were as follows: 5 Ayes: Representative(s) Yamane, Bertram, Brower, Carroll, Shimabukuro; Ayes with reservations: none; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Finnegan; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Nishimoto, Belatti, Mizuno.
